18.title: Photo Documentation Standards (Deep Dive)
photo_standards: All field photos must be high-res, color, and clearly labeled by location, system, and job number.
No blurry, dark, or cropped photos accepted—QA will request resubmission.
Required photos: pre, during, and post-work for each major measure (see Section 9 for overview).
Photos of every test result (CO, blower door, flue gas, pressure, etc.) must show instrument screen and label.
Education delivery and hazardous condition notification must be documented with an in-home photo.
Maintain backup/archive of all field photos for a minimum of 3 years.
backup_and_labeling_protocol: Filename includes job number, date, and location or system (e.g., 24-1065_attic_pre_2025-07-09.jpg).
All photos uploaded to IWx within 24 hours of field event.
QA reviews all photo submissions within 5 business days.
18.reference_policy: IHWAP Operations Manual (PY2026), Wxbot Photo Standards

20.title: Change Log/Versioning
change_log_requirements: Every logic, template, or training update is entered in the platform change log with date, summary, and staff initials.
Version number assigned to each major JSON, template, or QA module (e.g., v2.1.0).
All staff notified of major version changes via internal bulletin or app notice.
Archive old versions in read-only format for 3 years (minimum).
Audit reports reference logic/template version in effect at time of job.
semantic_versioning: Major = new feature or breaking change; Minor = routine update; Patch = bug fix or wording tweak.
20.reference_policy: Wxbot Version Control, IHWAP Audit Standards

21.title: Staff Onboarding Matrix
onboarding_steps: Complete staff intro and field safety training
Sign code of ethics and compliance acknowledgment
Assign mentor or pod lead for first 5 jobs
Pass QCI observation or mock field check

22.title: Code of Operations
principles: Act in good faith for the safety of all occupants.
Respect the dignity and privacy of every client.
Prioritize work that achieves maximum impact per dollar.
Follow all DOE, IHWAP, and local policies—even when inconvenient.
Report field issues, hazards, and all unsafe conditions immediately.
Collaborate and train staff continuously; share field wisdom.
Every override must be documented and justified.
No retaliation against whistleblowers or QA staff.
22.compliance_commitment: All staff and contractors must sign and adhere to the Code of Operations before performing or supervising field work.

23.title: Philosophy & Meta-Logic
meta_principles: The house is a system—every trigger and action affects the whole.
Health & safety > Home integrity > Energy efficiency.
Scout/FAAIE is a guide, not a replacement for field judgment.
Document every field decision, override, and deviation from standard.
Continuous improvement: learn from callbacks, audits, and legacy eggs.
Transparency, accountability, and humility win every audit.
staff_ethos: Every client deserves a safe, warm, healthy home.
No job is “routine”—every field event is an opportunity to serve.

24.title: Multi-State/Agency Logic
state_customizations: Each state has a dedicated Scout/FAAIE logic file—aligned to DOE and local rules.
Agency-specific triggers, workflow variances, and override procedures are tracked separately.
All shared logic updates are tagged and versioned by state/agency for audit trail.
Platform supports agency opt-in/opt-out for pilot logic, new modules, and legacy egg features.
interagency_best_practices: Document lessons learned from each pilot, share with national peer group.
Support logic exchanges for rapid compliance updates between agencies.
